title: Electrical Cords, Metal Pipes: In Kherson, Signs of Torture Emerge
description: The liberation of a Russian-held city was joyous. The revelations about what happened during occupation are anything but.

title: In a Polish Village, Renewed Fears of War Spilling Over From Ukraine
description: When missiles landed a few miles from the Ukrainian border, residents say they reignited fears that had largely calmed since the war’s early weeks.

title: What Videos Show About the Extremes of China’s ‘Zero-Covid’ Policy
description: A New York Times analysis examines the lengths China will go to  eliminate Covid infections. Three years into the pandemic, China stands out in the harshness of its measures.

title: What We Know About the Missile Involved in the Poland Blast
description: Both Russia and Ukraine have depended on the S-300 systems, which are built by Russia, as protection against incoming air assaults during the ongoing war.

title: Study: West African Floods 80 Times More Likely by Climate Change
description: Amid the ‘loss and damage’ debate at global climate talks, the study adds to evidence that less-developed countries suffer from warming that industrialized nations largely cause.

title: A New Focus on Jona Ostiglio, a Jewish Artist Who Broke Barriers
description: Fresh research into the life of Jona Ostiglio, a hitherto unknown 17th-century Jewish artist, reveals a unique painter who lived outside set boundaries.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Crisis Averted?
description: Leaders call an explosion in Poland an “unfortunate accident.” Plus, Tuvalu’s “digital twin.”

title: The Fatal Blast in Poland Shows the Heightened Risk of Escalation
description: The hasty and likely inaccurate reactions from some countries to the apparent explosion of a missile was worrisome, but so is Russia’s nuclear temptation in Ukraine.

title: UK Sees Varied Domestic Threats, Mainly From Iran, Russia and China
description: In an annual assessment, the head of M15 also cited Iranian attempts to kill or kidnap at least 10 critics of the Iran’s government.

title: Expectations Run High as an Exuberant Lula Speaks at Climate Summit
description: On Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva’s first trip abroad after winning last month’s election, he pledged to protect the Amazon rainforest and said Brazil was “leaving its cocoon.”

title: Small Polish Town Becomes the Center of Attention After Missile Blast
description: Poland’s president said that a Ukrainian air defense missile had most likely caused a deadly blast there on Tuesday.

title: As Netanyahu Nears Power, the Far Right Wants to Oversee the Army
description: Bezalel Smotrich is an ultranationalist who opposes Palestinian sovereignty and wants to govern Israel by Jewish law. He seeks the Defense Ministry in Benjamin Netanyahu’s government.

title: Xi Scolds Trudeau Over ‘Leaked’ Conversation in 40-Second Exchange
description: The exchange happened at the end of a summit where Mr. Xi has sought to steady China’s relations with the United States, Australia and other Western countries.

title: With a Missed Cancer Diagnosis, Vicky Phelan Exposed a Scandal
description: Ireland is mourning Ms. Phelan, who died this week. She became an advocate for women after a Pap smear that had been deemed negative turned out to be positive.

title: NATO and Poland Say Deadly Blast Was Likely Unintentional
description: The secretary general of NATO said that a Ukrainian air defense missile most likely caused the explosion on the Polish-Ukrainian border on Tuesday.

title: New Measure of Climate’s Toll: Disasters Are Now Common Across US
description: A new report found that 90 percent of all counties nationwide have suffered a major disaster since 2011.

title: Divided Government
description: A split Congress could lead to government shutdowns and economic turmoil.

title: NATO envoys gather as the explosion in Poland alarms the alliance.
NATO envoys gather as the explosion in Poland alarms the alliance.
G20 Summit Ends With Sanctions on Russia Still Dividing Some Countries
description: The meeting did not result in the customary joint communiqué, and the “leaders’ declaration” issued instead noted “different assessments” of the war in Ukraine.

title: A Clash at Climate Talks: Should Nations Keep the 1.5-Degree Goal?
description: The mantra has been: Limit global warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius or risk climate catastrophe. But at COP27, there are concerns about backsliding.

title: Fighting Climate Change, Indigenous People Protect Canadian Forests
description: Canada is looking to its Indigenous communities to help manage its boreal forests, the world’s largest intact forest ecosystem and one of its biggest stores of carbon.

title: Lockdowns Set Off Rare Protest in Guangzhou in China
description: Weary migrants thronged a street in the manufacturing hub of Guangzhou to protest food shortages and lengthy stay-at-home orders under China’s strict “zero-Covid” policy.

title: Amid Crises, Biden Offers the World a Choice: My Way, or Trump’s
description: The president put his coalition-building approach on display on a trip through Asia, where he sought to ease tensions with China.

title: How Britain’s Crackdown on Gangs Disproportionately Targets Young Black Men
description: A murder-conspiracy case in northwestern England tells the story of Britain’s crackdown on gangs, which disproportionately targets young Black men.

title: Jeremy Hunt Will Be the UK’s Bearer of Bad News
description: Jeremy Hunt, the chancellor of the Exchequer, is known for his competence and sober demeanor, which he will most likely need as he outlines tax increases and public spending cuts.

title: How Countries Are Responding to  the Explosion in Poland
description: Poland said a Russian-made missile was involved, while Russia denied involvement.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: A missile that killed two people in Poland does not appear to have come from Russia, according to President Biden.

title: How a US Teacher Evaded Russian Troops in Kherson for 8 Months
description: Timothy Morales, a teacher, was trapped in the southern Ukrainian city during the occupation. To evade Russian troops, he rarely ventured out, switched apartments and pretended to be Irish.

title: Biden Says Missile That Killed 2 in Poland Was Probably Not Fired From Russia
description: It was unclear from the president’s remarks whether he meant the missile was not likely to have been fired from inside Russia, or by Russian forces in Ukraine or elsewhere.

title: Poland Suggests Russian-Made Missile Killed 2 Inside Its Borders
description: The explosion in a Polish village across the border from Ukraine occurred as Russia bombarded Ukrainian cities with about 100 missiles.

title: Iran Cracks Down as Protests Show No Sign of Easing
description: Security forces fired on a crowd at a metro station on Tuesday, setting off a panicked rush of commuters, video showed.
